lines.text: 2.  Introduction to Foundation Level Agile Tester Extension

spans.text: Introduction to Foundation Level Agile Tester Extension

lines.text: The certification for Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester is designed for professionals who are

spans.text: The certification for Foundation Level Extension –
Agile Tester is designed for professionals who are

lines.text: working within Agile environments. It is also for professionals who are planning to start implementing

spans.text: working within Agile environments. It is also for professionals who are planning to start implementing

lines.text: Agile methods in the near future, or are working within companies that plan to do so, The certification

spans.text: Agile methods in the near future, or are working within companies that plan to do so, The certification

lines.text: provides an advantage for those who would like to know the required Agile activities, roles, methods, and

spans.text: provides an advantage for those who would like to know the required Agile activities, roles, methods, and

lines.text: The Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester qualification is aimed at four main groups of professionals:

spans.text: Agile Tester qualification is aimed at four main groups of professionals:

lines.text: 1. Professionals who have achieved in-depth testing experience in traditional methods and would

lines.text: 3. Professionals who are relatively new to testing and are required to implement test approaches,

lines.text: 3.  Overview of the Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester

spans.text: Overview of the Foundation Level Extension –

lines.text: This section lists the Business Outcomes expected of a candidate who has achieved the Foundation Level

spans.text: This section lists the Business Outcomes expected of a candidate who has achieved the Foundation Level

lines.text: AFM1  Collaborate in a cross-functional Agile team being familiar with principles and basic

spans.text: Collaborate in a cross-functional Agile team being familiar with principles and basic

lines.text: AFM2  Adapt existing testing experience and knowledge to Agile values and principles.

spans.text: Adapt existing testing experience and knowledge to Agile values and principles.

lines.text: AFM3  Support the Agile team in planning test-related activities.

spans.text: Support the Agile team in planning test-related activities.

lines.text: AFM4  Apply relevant methods and techniques for testing in an Agile project.

spans.text: Apply relevant methods and techniques for testing in an Agile project.

lines.text: AFM5  Assist the Agile team in test automation activities.

spans.text: Assist the Agile team in test automation activities.

lines.text: AFM6  Assist business stakeholders in defining understandable and testable user stories,

spans.text: Assist business stakeholders in defining understandable and testable user stories,

lines.text: scenarios, requirements and acceptance criteria as appropriate.

spans.text: scenarios, requirements and acceptance criteria as appropriate.

lines.text: AFM7  Work and share information with other team members using effective communication

spans.text: Work and share information with other team members using effective communication

lines.text: In general, a Certified Tester Foundation Level – Agile Tester is expected to have acquired the necessary

spans.text: In general, a Certified Tester Foundation Level –
Agile Tester is expected to have acquired the necessary

lines.text: skills to working effectively within an Agile team and environment.

spans.text: skills to working effectively within an Agile team and environment.

lines.text: The tester should remember the basic concept of Agile software development based on the Agile

spans.text: The tester should remember the basic concept of Agile software development based on the Agile

lines.text: The tester should understand the advantages of the whole-team approach and the benefits of

spans.text: The tester should understand the advantages of the whole-team approach and the benefits of

lines.text: The tester should recall Agile software development approaches.

spans.text: The tester should recall Agile software development approaches.

lines.text: The tester should be able to write testable user stories in collaboration with developers and

spans.text: The tester should be able to write testable user stories in collaboration with developers and

lines.text: The tester should understand how retrospectives can be used as a mechanism for process

spans.text: The tester should understand how retrospectives can be used as a mechanism for process

lines.text: The tester should understand the use and purpose of continuous integration.

spans.text: The tester should understand the use and purpose of continuous integration.

lines.text: The tester should know the differences between iteration and release planning, and how a tester

spans.text: The tester should know the differences between iteration and release planning, and how a tester

lines.text: adds value in each of these activities.

spans.text: adds value in each of these activities.

lines.text: Chapter 2: Fundamental Agile Testing Principles, Practices, and Processes

spans.text: Chapter 2: Fundamental Agile Testing Principles, Practices, and Processes

lines.text: The tester should be able to describe the differences between testing activities in Agile projects

spans.text: The tester should be able to describe the differences between testing activities in Agile projects

lines.text: The tester should be able to describe how development and testing activities are integrated in

spans.text: The tester should be able to describe how development and testing activities are integrated in

spans.text: The tester should be able to describe the role of independent testing in Agile projects.

lines.text: The tester should be able to describe the tools and techniques used to communicate the status of

spans.text: The tester should be able to describe the tools and techniques used to communicate the status of

lines.text: testing in an Agile project, including test progress and product quality.

spans.text: testing in an Agile project, including test progress and product quality.

spans.text: The tester should be able to describe the process of evolving tests across multiple iterations and

lines.text: explain why test automation is important to manage regression risk in Agile projects.

spans.text: explain why test automation is important to manage regression risk in Agile projects.

lines.text: The tester should understand the skills (people, domain, and testing) of a tester in an Agile team.

spans.text: Chapter 3: Agile Testing Methods, Techniques, and Tools

lines.text: The tester should be able to recall the concepts of test-driven development, acceptance test-

spans.text: The tester should be able to summarize the testing quadrants and their relationships with testing

lines.text: For a given Agile project, the tester should be able to work as a tester in a Scrum team.

spans.text: For a given Agile project, the tester should be able to work as a tester in a Scrum team.

lines.text: The tester should be able to assess quality risks within an Agile project.

spans.text: The tester should be able to assess quality risks within an Agile project.

spans.text: The tester should be able to estimate testing effort based on iteration content and quality risks.

spans.text: The tester should be able to interpret relevant information to support testing activities.

spans.text: Given a user story, the tester should be able to write acceptance test-driven development test

spans.text: For both functional and non-functional behavior, the tester should be able to write test cases using
